availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John Jackson Morgan (Trimble County Farmer and Judge)

body.p: Trimble County, Kentucky, sheriff, magistrate, and farmer. Trimble County, Kentucky native. Son of John D. Morgan and Elizabeth Taylor Morgan. Married to Mary E. F. Ewing Morgan in Trimble County on November 10, 1853. Father of William R. Morgan, John F. Morgan, Annie B. Morgan, George R. Morgan, Mary K. Morgan, Augustus M. Morgan, Lou A. Morgan, James T. Morgan, Robert L. Morgan, Edwin G. Morgan, Charley R. Morgan, Lizzie W. Morgan and Virgil H. Morgan. Sheriff of Trimble County, Kentucky from 1854 to 1857. Magistrate of Trimble County from 1856 to 1873. Farmer in Trimble County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Trimble County, p. 11.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records – Microfilm (1852-1910), KDLA, Roll #994054, Trimble County Marriages.
W. H. Perrin, J. H. Battle, and G. C. Kniffin, Kentucky: A History of the State, 6th ed. (Louisville and Chicago: F. A. Battey and Company, 1887), 829-30.
Vital Statistics Original Death Certificates – Microfilm (1911-1964), KDLA, Roll #7016137, Oldham County Deaths, File #24225.
Find A Grave, "John Jackson Morgan (September 14, 1826-September 24, 1911)," Memorial #21552097, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/21552097 (accessed August 3, 2018).
